linkTarget.anchoringText: The Cygnus Field1 (Fig 1) is located in United Kingdom blocks 44/11a and 44/12a, in licence P1055, approximately 12km north of the Munro Field and 15km northwest of the Tyne Field. The Field is operated by Neptune E & P UK Ltd on behalf of partnership (Neptune Energy and Spirit Energy UK).

image-wrap.label: Figure 1
image-wrap.caption: Location map of the Cygnus gas field (after Catto et al. 2017)8

formatted-caption.caption-text: Location map of the Cygnus gas field (after Catto et al. 2017)8

linkTarget.bib:
Catto and Catto, 2017 Catto
R. Taggart Catto . 2017 Petroleum Geology of the Cygnus gas field, UK North Sea: from discovery to development. In: Bowman, M. & Levell, B. (Eds) Petroleum Geology of NW Europe: 50 Years of Learning - Proceedings of the 8th Petroleum Geology Conference . Geological Society of London

linkTarget.anchoringText: Cygnus is a light, sweet gas. The reported liquid yield is between 1 and 3 bbl/mmscf and associated condensate is light and it is also assumed that the same gas composition (Fig 2) is present in the Leman and Carboniferous reservoirs.

bib.article-title: Technical Memorandum Cygnus Fluid Chemistry by Ester Soru November 4 2011

linkTarget.anchoringText: Composition of formation water (Fig 3) samples from 44/12a-2 and 44/12a-3 wells and MDT pressure data support the view that a sole formation water composition exists throughout the field. Both Leman and Carboniferous reservoirs are supported by the same aquifer. The fluid sample indicates high concentration of Sodium and Chloride ions compared to the other ions present in the fluid. Also, the Cygnus formation fluids contain a high amount of total dissolved solids (Fig 4) averaging at 320,000 mg/l.

bib.article-title: Technical Memorandum Cygnus Fluid Chemistry by Ester Soru November 4 2011

linkTarget.anchoringText: Composition of formation water (Fig 3) samples from 44/12a-2 and 44/12a-3 wells and MDT pressure data support the view that a sole formation water composition exists throughout the field. Both Leman and Carboniferous reservoirs are supported by the same aquifer. The fluid sample indicates high concentration of Sodium and Chloride ions compared to the other ions present in the fluid. Also, the Cygnus formation fluids contain a high amount of total dissolved solids (Fig 4) averaging at 320,000 mg/l.

image-wrap.caption: Cygnus Formation Water Total Dissolved Solids2

formatted-caption.caption-text: Cygnus Formation Water Total Dissolved Solids2

bib.article-title: Technical Memorandum Cygnus Fluid Chemistry by Ester Soru November 4 2011

linkTarget.anchoringText: The Southern North Sea (SNS) halite risk areas are shown in (Fig 5). The zones in red are indicate where halite deposition has been experienced by some operators and has caused flow assurance issues. Cygnus is located in a high risk area.

bib.article-title: Synergy Review of Salt Plugging in SNS Wells (DECC Review 2010 Salt Workshop)

linkTarget.anchoringText: Halite precipitation in SNS has been observed for both Carboniferous and Rotliegendes formations. In order to assess the risk for halite precipitation in Cygnus Field; a halite model has been constructed based on the Cygnus water chemistry. The halite precipitation envelope as a function of P, T and WGR is shown in (Fig 6 and 17).

image-wrap.caption: Cygnus Halite Envelope Bottom Hole Region

Prior to installing the completion string for the first development well offshore, multiple factory acceptance and stack up test were carried out at the workshop and test rig onshore (Attachment 1 - 3). The aim was to test and confirm the integrity of the sub-assemblies, to ascertain the robustness of the operational procedures and simulate the deployment of the upper and lower completion strings. Lessons were captured and updated in the completion execution programs.

image-wrap.caption: Attachment 1 Stack Up Testing of the Completion Assembly

formatted-caption.caption-text: Attachment 1 Stack Up Testing of the Completion Assembly

linkTarget.anchoringText: The Cygnus Field data flow (Fig 8) above shows how high frequency data from source (well and facilities) offshore flows to onshore applications, cleaning and final use for detailed analyses and use. Due to Cygnus completion philosophy (Attachment 5 & 6), the permanent down-hole gauges are installed ca 4,000 ft tvd above Top reservoir in each of the wells.

The Cygnus Field data flow (Fig 8) above shows how high frequency data from source (well and facilities) offshore flows to onshore applications, cleaning and final use for detailed analyses and use. Due to Cygnus completion philosophy (Attachment 5 & 6), the permanent down-hole gauges are installed ca 4,000 ft tvd above Top reservoir in each of the wells.
